summary_points: 1. On March 31, 2025, J. Michael Hansen announced his retirement as Cintas Corporation's Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer (CFO), transitioning to the role of Assistant to the Chief Executive Officer effective May 31, 2025.

2. Scott Garula was appointed to succeed Mr. Hansen as EVP & CFO, effective June 1, 2025, with an initial annual base salary of $650,000, a target annual incentive of 90% of base salary, and a target long-term incentive opportunity of $1,500,000.
3.  Mr. Garula will also receive one-time long-term incentive awards with an aggregate grant date fair value of $325,000 upon his promotion.

1. Bunge Global SA's subsidiary, Bunge Limited Finance Corp. (BLFC), extended the expiration date of its exchange offers and consent solicitations from April 7, 2025, to May 5, 2025, contingent upon the completion of Bunge's acquisition of Viterra.
2. As of April 4, 2025,  a significant majority (over 96%) of outstanding Viterra 2026, 2027, and 2031 notes, and 97.3% of the 2032 notes, had been tendered in the exchange offers.
3.  BLFC anticipates further extending the expiration date if Bunge's acquisition of Viterra isn't completed by May 5, 2025.

1. Atmos Energy Corp. extended the maturity dates of both its $1.5 billion Three Year Credit Facility and its $1.5 billion Five Year Credit Facility by one year, to March 28, 2028, and March 28, 2030, respectively, effective March 31, 2025.
2. This filing is an 8-K report filed on April 4, 2025, related to material definitive agreements, specifically the extension of credit facilities.
3. The extension of the credit facilities could impact Atmos Energy Corp.'s future financial flexibility and borrowing costs depending on market conditions in the coming years.
1. FactSet acquired LiquidityBook and Irwin for a combined $364 million (net of cash) in 2025, contributing to a 4.5% year-over-year revenue increase to $570.7 million by February 28, 2025.

2. A material weakness in FactSet's internal control over financial reporting, stemming from IT general control deficiencies, was identified as of February 28, 2025, but remediation is anticipated by the end of fiscal year 2025.
3. FactSet's accounts receivable reserve rose to $15.0 million by February 28, 2025, a slight increase from $14.6 million on August 31, 2024.
1. As of April 3, 2025, News Corp repurchased approximately US$656,997,513.87 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2.  On April 3, 2025, 21,436,785 Class A shares and 10,578,961 Class B shares were repurchased, totaling US$656,997,513.87.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced previously, continues with the intention to repurchase more Class A and Class B common stock, subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. Dover Corporation established a new $500 million 364-day revolving credit facility on April 3, 2025, replacing its previous facility which expired on the same date.
2.  The new credit facility matures on April 2, 2026, with a one-year extension option contingent on certain conditions.
3. The filing includes a 364-Day Credit Agreement detailing the terms of the new facility, including interest rates, fees, and covenants.
